description.narrative: Communities in the targeted districts have improved capacity to achieve sustainable Open Defecation Free (ODF) status by 2018, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3.0 Improved and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation and healthy environment and improved hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities in the targeted districts have improved capacity to achieve sustainable ODF status by 2018

description.narrative: The total number of people practicing open defecation reduced from 1,112,662 to 912,763 nationally. Over 2019 an increase of access to improved sanitation services has resulted in communities in the target districts having greater capacity to achieve sustainable ODF status. An estimated 199,899 (103,948 female and 95,951 male) more people living in 536 open defecation free (ODF) communities are using 20,500 newly constructed household latrines and 19,500 handwashing stations. Other WASH actors have reached a total of 67,200 beneficiaries (34,944 female). | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

Number of additional people living in the newly certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities as a result of UNICEF CATS programming during the year of reporting
